projectDesc.p: "木蘭花" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

editorialDecl.p: Transcriptions and translations are encoded in XML conforming to TEI (P5) guidelines. The original-language text is contained within <lem> tags and translations within <rdg> tags.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: The water in the pond is green, the wind slightly warm.
I remember meeting the jade-like beauty for the first time.
The Double-heads song in the beat of the chimes’ tinkle,
as it entered the po chapter, her waist swung and red skirt swirled.
By the railings under the jade hook and in front the fragrant steps,
I was drunk, not knowing that the sun had slanted and the time was late.
The ones who appreciated the flowers with me at that time,
now as I count them, are less than half.
